Text: thanks AiTB you were faster than me , i will promote this

Command & Conquer 4: Tiberian Twilight (c) Electronic Arts

       03/2010 :..... RELEASE.DATE .. PROTECTION .......: EA DRM
             1 :.......... DISC(S) .. GAME.TYPE ........: Strategy



 Behold disciples of Nod, for the end is soon upon us. Electronic Arts'
 award-winning and best-selling Tiberium saga is coming to a powerful
 conclusion with Command & Conquer 4, which will introduce a multitude of
 innovations to the classic fast and fluid Command & Conquer gameplay, while
 retaining the core compulsions that fans have come to love over the series'
 history.

 It is the year 2062 and humanity is at the brink of extinction. Tiberium, the
 mysterious, alien crystalline structure that has infested Earth for decades
 and served as the primary reason for years of relentless conflict between the
 Global Defense Initiative (GDI) and the Brotherhood of Nod, is close to
 rendering the planet uninhabitable. Mankind is on the verge of extinction
 when Kane, Nod's prophetic leader, emerges from seclusion to deliver GDI the
 message that he has developed a system that could control Tiberium and
 harness its power. But he cannot build this "Tiberium Control Network"
 without GDI's cooperation. Thus, the two opposing factions - GDI and Nod
 - inevitably find themselves in desperation for the same cause: to stop
 Tiberium from extinguishing mankind.

 After 15 years, the network is nearly complete, Tiberium is under strict
 control and our revitalized, newly terraformed planet is on the cusp of a new
 age of prosperity and progress. It is then that the world's citizens begin to
 seriously ponder why Kane chose to help, and what will he want in return.
 These questions and more lead to the dramatic final act of the Tiberium saga.

 With a multitude of innovative new features to the fast and fluid C&C
 gameplay, Command & Conquer 4 offers players an entirely new way to play C&C.
 An all-in-one mobile base, persistent player progression across all game
 modes that is constantly updated in a real-time online profile, a 3-class
 system for each of the two factions, co-operative play, and a 5v5
 objective-based multiplayer mode that promotes teamwork and social
 interaction, make Command & Conquer 4 unlike any other C&C experience.


 * When you're blocking C&C 4 from firewall, make sure you allow connection
   to 127.0.0.1 (loopback to your PC), or else the game won't work.
 * You can update the game by running the original CNC4.exe,
   so back it up.
 * The BONUS PRE-ORDER mission is available.

 1. Burn or mount the image.
 2. Install the game.
 3. Copy over the cracked content.
 4. Play the game.
 5. Vote with you wallet.

I can see the positive side of compressing things into multiple .rar files. If the files become corrupted during download, what would you rather do? Delete 1 or 2 rar files and redownload them, or delete the entire 7.5 gig uncompressed file and redownload it instead?
.raring files makes it easier *incase* something goes wrong. Fine, it takes a little more time to unpack and requires a good bit of HD space, but I'd still prefer it over having to redownload a large file overnight.

Well...the honest truth is this game is one of 2 things.

A) The best Real Time Tactics game I've ever played.
or
B) The worst Real Time Strategy game I've ever played.

That said, you can't blame the C&C fan base for feeling a bit betrayed.  There's change, and then there's a total series reboot.  This is like a reboot without rebooting the story along with it.  Reboots can be good, it keeps things fresh, but you don't do a reboot when the game is the last game in the entire storyline.  It's just pointless.

That said, on second thought, World in Conflict is a better Real Time Tactics game too.  Well, and EndWar.  And Universe At War.  And Ground Control.  And pretty much any other Real Time Tactics game released since 2001.  But other than those, C&C4 isn't bad.

That said, I played it for roughly 20 hours over the span of a week and have now uninstalled it.  It's not bad, but it's not worth 5GB+ on my 64GB SSD either.

Time to redownload WiC I suppose.  *sigh*

OMG I couldnt believe what shit of a "game" this is - the effects, the graphics, the gameplay - absolutely terrible - games from 1998 were 1000x better than this crap which they sell us as C&C4. It has nothing to do with Command&Conquer anymore as we know it.

With regards to graphics, when I discovered that the graphics settings were set on low by default and I changed it to high - incredible difference - things improved slightly, but it didnt change the fact that the game is hideously slow paced (changing game speed not possible), laggy, boring, repetitive, badly designed, just SHIT! Though I didn't expect much of a 3D C&C since 3D simply doesn't work effectively on RTS games - it only sets limits, without improving anything.  "Emperor: battle for dune" from 2001 was also in 3D, of course I didn't like it one bit, yet it is still 100x better than this cheap shit, there is absolutely no comparison.

I deleted the game from my hard disc right after wasting my time with (playing) a few missions. Not worth the bandwidth and time.

I dont no what the people are talking about when they cant get this to work, i followed the instruction as advised & it works fine & im using a intel MacMini using WindowsXP via Parallels.

below is what i did...

I Burned the image to a (DL-DVD) Dual-Layer DVD Disc Using Toast (as i am using Mac OS X Snow Leopard)

Then...Using Windows XP via Parallels i inserted the disc as you would normally insert a dvd then automatically a dialog box shows up asking you to install C&C4. (Very Good Stuff)

..it did take awhile to install, but once it did i then had to copy over the cracked content before playing or stating the game, so i went into explore the dvd-disc that i inserted & there sure enough i found a folder called "crack" so i opened it up dragged whatever was inside and copied it over to the main folder that has been saved by C&C4 installer which you will find in the programmes folder & once that was done everything is ready.

So all you have to do now is open the Game & Play, o yes, once you start the game wait awhile for it to load & once it does a dialog box will show up with two option buttons, one with "server" & the other with play game, click on the server option first then you will notice the other button allowing you now to press it, so go ahead & press the Play game button & it will start up.

The Game Works wonderfully, you cant play server multiplayer games, but playing the computer is just fine by me & if you have a power-full games computer you can use the Full Graphics Settings & see how nice it is.

This torrent Works fine & the game is awesome, but you will need some common sense when trying to install this.

Congrats to the Uploader & Everyone Make-Sure you Seed as Sharing is Caring & the Cyber World will be a better place for it, even though sometimes reality is boring.

I did a tad of research on what it actually is. The file is classified as a virus because whatever software is actually being executed is being wrapped in a container that prevents antivirus operations. So it is impossible to know whether there actually is a malicious program or not. Use at your own risk, preferably on a privilege-limited account if you do.
